properties.name: update_context
properties.description:
Instruct another agent to make changes to the story context.

IMPORTANT: 
- Changes to existing context: you MUST ALWAYS provide the specific Context ID of the entry you wish to affect. If you do not have the context ID, retrieve it first by querying for the information. Context IDs must be fenced in backticks (`)  E.g., `context_type:path.id`
- Creating new context: You cannot decide its Context ID, it will be automatically created as part of the process.

You are allowed to make the following changes:
properties.instructions: Instruct another agent to make changes to the World, Characters, History or Story configuration. Changes can mean updates, creations or removals.

properties.name: instructions
properties.instructions: Concrete, actionable and concise instructions to the agent on what character changes need to be done.

properties.name: instructions
properties.instructions: Concrete, actionable and concise instructions to the agent on what world information changes need to be done.

properties.name: instructions
properties.instructions: Concrete, actionable and concise instructions to the agent on what story configuration changes need to be done.

properties.name: instructions
properties.instructions: Concrete, actionable and concise instructions to the agent on what static history information changes need to be done.

properties.name: instructions
properties.instructions: Concrete, actionable and concise instructions to the agent on what needs to be done.

Changes to world entries must go to the `world_changes` function.

- World entry creation / deletion / updates

IMPORTANT: This cannot be used for static history entries, which are a special kind of context.

examples.instructions: Create a new world entry called 'The Crystal Caverns of Eldereth' describing the magical underground chambers where ancient dragons once hoarded their treasures.
Update the existing world entry 'Mars Colony Beta-7' to include information about the recent discovery of underground water deposits and the new mining operations.
Add a new history entry showing that two years ago, Emma and her mother had a big fight about Emma's decision to drop out of college.
Delete the world entry 'Haunted Mansion on Hill Street' as the supernatural elements are being removed from the story.

properties.instructions: Changes to static history entries must go to the history_changes function.

examples.instructions: Create a new static history entry for 1 week ago that describes how Jenna and Rob met at the birthday party
Remove the static history entry that states Richard fought a dragon and one. Context ID: `history_entry.static:3d4a2dfc`
Change the static history entry `history_entry.static:3d4a2dfc` - keep it as is but add that they went to the game afterwards.

properties.instructions:
Changes to story configuration must go to the `story_config_changes` function.

- Story introductory text changes
- Story intention changes
- Current scene intention and type changes
- Scene type creation / deletion / updates
- Activate or deactivate permanent context pins (via Context ID)

examples.instructions: Modify the current scene intention to transition from tense negotiation to action sequence as the bomb timer reaches its final minutes.
Activate a pin for `world_entry.manual:c578f00dd1a9` as its currently very relevant to the scene.

properties.name: instructions
properties.instructions: Provide concise and actionable instructions to another agent to create a new persistent character in the story.

properties.name: active
properties.instructions: Set to true if this character needs to become an ACTIVE participant in the scene immediately.

properties.name: narrate_instructions
properties.instructions: If `activate` is true and the character has not entered the scene yet, provide instructions to the writer on how the character's entry should be narrated.

Any character specific changes go to this function.

- Character attribute changes
- Character description changes
- Character detail changes
- Character name changes
- Character UX color changes
- Character voice assignment changes
- Deactivation / Activation of a character
- Dialogue examples for a character
- Acting instructions for a character

examples.instructions: Create a new character named Lyra Moonwhisper, a 150-year-old elven mage with silver hair and ancient knowledge of forbidden spells. Make her active in the current scene.
Update Commander Zara's personality attribute to show that her experiences with the alien parasites have made her more paranoid and suspicious of her crew.
Change Dr. Chen's character voice assignment from the current narrator to 'Sarah (Neural)' to give her a more clinical and professional speaking style.
Deactivate Detective Morgan from the current scene. Have him excuse himself to take an important phone call from the chief, leaving through the office door.

Create Dr. Elena Vasquez, a 34-year-old forensic psychologist with expertise in criminal profiling. She has shoulder-length dark hair, wire-rimmed glasses, and speaks with a slight accent. She's analytical but impatient with incompetence.
examples.narrate_instructions: Dr. Vasquez enters the precinct carrying a leather briefcase, her heels clicking purposefully on the tile floor as she scans the busy room with sharp, observant eyes.

examples.instructions: Create Thornwick the Wise, an ancient dragon who has been sleeping in the Crystal Caverns for centuries. He has emerald scales, golden eyes, and vast knowledge of forgotten magic. He's cautious but curious about the modern world.

properties.description_chat:
Make changes to an existing character's attributes, details, description, acting instructions, example dialogue, scene entry / exit.

Activating or deactivating an existing character's scene participation: if the character's exit or entry has not yet been narrated, also provide instructions on how to narrate their exit or entry.
instruction_examples: Remove david from the current scene, have him exit the room, slamming the door behind him.
Activate Sarah. The narrative already covers her entry to the scene, so we just need to make sure she can active participate in it, no need for entry narration.

properties.description_chat: Update, add or remove world information.
instruction_examples: Add a new world entry for the Crystal Caverns. Describe the caverns as a magical place with ancient magic and hidden treasures.

properties.description_chat:
Make changes to the story / experience's configuration: Title, Description, Introduction, Content Classification, Story Intention, Scene Intention and Scene Type.

Manage Contextual Pins (add, update, remove pins of world entries).
instruction_examples: Update the story intention to be more specific about the expected story's mature content.

properties.description_chat:
Update, add or remove static history entries.

Historical entries are special static context items that have a specific time period attached. When creating new static history you MUST always explicitly state how long ago the event took place.
instruction_examples: Add a new static history entry stating how Mary met David at a coffeeshop two years ago. David was working on his novel when Mary tripped and poured coffee all over him.

properties.description_chat:
Create a new persistent character.

IMPORTANT: Only use this for characters that need to participate in the scene in a meaningful and peristent way. Background characters that can be handled with a few rounds of narration are not the appropriate target for this action.

Always confirm with the user before creating a new character.

When creating a new character you MUST always specify whether they need to immediately participate in the scene (e.g., be activated) or not. If yes also provide instructions on how they enter the scene.
properties.description_scene_direction:
Create a new persistent character.

IMPORTANT: Only use this for characters that need to participate in the scene in a meaningful and peristent way. Background characters that can be handled with a few rounds of narration are not the appropriate target for this action.

If the user keeps attempting to interact with a character that is not persisted yet that may indicate that the character may need be made persistent.

When creating a new character you MUST always specify whether they need to immediately participate in the scene (e.g., be activated) or not. If yes also provide instructions on how they enter the scene.
instruction_examples: Create Thornwick the Wise, an ancient dragon who has been sleeping in the Crystal Caverns for centuries. He has emerald scales, golden eyes, and vast knowledge of forgotten magic. He's cautious but curious about the modern world. He should not be active in the scene at this point.

properties.name: is_player
properties.instructions: Set to true if this character is to be a user controlled character. NOTE: There can only be ONE user controlled character.

example_json.name: example_json
example_json.description: An example JSON payload for the action
